result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jairo Andres Carmago-Angulo

records.addlTxt: 10:22 AM - case called.  Defendant Jairo Andres Carmago-Angulo in court.  Attorney Steven Mitchell Michlig in court for Jairo Andres Carmago-Angulo.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Polzin regarding plea agreement.  Court questions Atty Michlig/Defendant.  Responses by Atty Michlig/Defendant.  State moves to amend Count 1 to Disorderly Conduct.  Court grants State's motion to amend charge to 947.01.  Plea to amended Count 1 is no contest.  Waiver of rights and tendering plea.  Waiver free and voluntary.  Factual basis exits for plea.  Found guilty by the Court.  Court will withhold the entry of a judgment of conviction.  Joint recommendation.  Statement by Atty Polzin/Atty Michlig/Defendant regarding plea agreement.  Court notes no victim appeared.  Court approves of the terms and conditions of the DEJ for a period of 12 months.  Court will sign an Order.  Bond will continue during the 12 month DEJ period.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 29, 2022 at 10:20 am.

2:36 PM - case called.  Attorney Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared by video for Jairo Andres Carmago-Angulo.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Polzin - victim rights scheduling conference; no victim wishes to be heard.  Statement by the Court - off the record scheduling with Judicial Assistant.
No contact with the victim.  Submit to Lincoln County Sheriff's Department for booking if not already completed.
Relay Sheet / Identification Processing / DNA at Arrest
Status conference on April 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
No contact with the victim.  Submit to Lincoln County Sheriff's Department for booking if not already completed.

1:40 PM - case called.  Defendant Jairo Andres Carmago-Angulo appeared in court.  Attorney Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared in court for Jairo Andres Carmago-Angulo.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin appeared in court for State of Wisconsin.  State has complied with victim rights.  Statement by Atty Michlig - in receipt of complaint - waive reading - plea of not guilty.  Court accepts not guilty plea.  Argument by State as to bond.  Response by Atty Michlig.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response.  Court sets bond.
Status conference scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
